sense.name: take into consideration
sense.examples: She always thinks about her children first. Think about going to college! Think of all the starving children before you decide. He thought of going to the event, but he lived too far.

sense.name: carefully plan, ponder or mull over
sense.commentary: Includes: THINK OUT, THINK OVER, THINK TWICE
sense.examples: The project is both modest and ambitious, and very well thought out. Take your time to think your answers over. A coward thinks twice before jumping in the cage with a lion.

sense.name: THINK BACK: remember or reminesce
sense.examples: Putting down the ageing paper, Mrs. Tagore thought back at those days.

sense.name: THINK OF: regard something or someone as
sense.examples: He thinks of himself as a brilliant musician. Traditionally UDP traffic is thought of as noise on the network.

sense.name: THINK OF-refer to
sense.examples: I'm thinking of good food when I talk about France. I am thinking of Julia when I say that.

sense.name: create, dream up, or invent in mind
sense.examples: He thought up a plan to get rich quickly. Think of any integer between 1 and 25. No one had ever thought of such a clever piece of software.

sense.name: THINK THE WORLD OF-esteem very highly
sense.examples: She thinks the world of that tabby cat of hers.
